data.name: UnknownScenarioName
data.value: 01: Error - Unknown scenario name

data.name: CommandLineSwitches
data.value:
Usage: {0} [<options>]
Options: -S <ScenarioName> Run <ScenarioName> from the following list of scenarios available to SaRACmd.exe: ExpertExperienceAdminTask - Advanced Diagnostics \ Outlook \ Create a detailed report of my Outlook, Office, Windows and mailbox configuration OfficeScrubScenario - Office \ I have Office installed, but I'm having trouble uninstalling it TeamsAddinScenario - Teams \ The Teams meeting option isn't shown or the Teams Meeting add-in doesn't load in Outlook TeamsPresenceScenario - Teams \ User presence status information isn't shown or the Teams Meeting add-in doesn't load in Outlook OfficeActivationScenario – Office \ I’ve installed a subscription version of Office, but I can’t activate it OutlookCalendarCheckTask – Advance Diagnostics \ Outlook \ Create a detailed scan of my Outlook Calendar to identify and resolve issues OfficeSharedComputerScenario – Office\ I want to setup Office with shared computer activation on a computer or server in my organization. ResetOfficeActivation – Command-line only scenario for resetting the Office Activation state. OfficeRoiScanNormalScenario – Command-line only scenario for doing a normal Roi scan of the Office installation. OfficeRoiScanFullScenario – Command-line only scenario for doing a full Roi scan of the Office installation. OfficeSignInScenario – Command-line only scenario for detecting and fixing issues with Office sign-in. OutlookConnectivityScenario – Command-line only scenario for detecting and fixing intermittent Outlook connection problems. OutlookAuthCheckScenario – Command-line only scenario for fixing authentication/password issues with Outlook. OfficeSetupScenario - Office \ Command-line scenario to install Office OutlookEmailSetupScenario \ Command-line scenario to set up a Microsoft 365 email in Outlook OutlookHangCrashScenario \ Command-line scenario to solve Outlook won't start/hang crash issues -CloseOffice The -CloseOffice switch is required to run the OfficeActivationScenario, OfficeSharedComputerScenario and ResetOfficeActivation scenarios. Note, the –CloseOffice switch closes Office applications. For additional information, please visit https://aka.ms/SaRA_CommandLineVersion -RemoveSCA The -RemoveSCA switch is optional for the OfficeActivationScenario and OfficeSharedComputerScenario scenarios. This switch removes Shared Computer Activation (SCA) and configures non SCA activation for Office. For additional information, please visit https://aka.ms/SaRA_CommandLineVersion -P <Profile Name> The -P switch is optional for the OutlookCalendarCheckTask scenario. Profile name is the Outlook profile that is scanned by the OutlookCalendarCheckTask scenario. -LogFolder <Output Path> The -LogFolder switch is optional for the ExpertExperienceAdminTask and OutlookCalendarCheckTask scenarios. If used, the -LogFolder switch forces SaraCmd.exe to output scenario-specific logs to the folder specified by <Output Path> -CloseOutlook The -CloseOutlook switch is required to run the TeamsAddinScenario scenario. Warning - this switch closes Outlook, if running. -OfficeVersion <version> The -OfficeVersion switch is optional for the OfficeScrubScenario scenario. If used, the -OfficeVersion specifies a <version> of Office to uninstall. For this switch, allowable values for <version> are: All, M365, 2021, 2019, 2016, 2013, 2010, or 2007. Note, the All value removes all Office versions from your machine. -OfflineScan The -OfflineScan switch is optional and only works with the ExpertExperienceAdminTask scenario. This switch forces an offline scan of Outlook when the application is running. -HideProgress The `-HideProgress` switch is optional and only works with the ExpertExperienceTask and OutlookCalendarCheckTask scenarios. The default feature is to always show progress. When this switch is used, it hides the progress display for these scenarios. -AcceptEula Accept the End-User License Agreement (EULA) on behalf of the user on whose machine SaRACmd.exe is being run. It is required for all scenarios. Use -DisplayEula to see the contents of the EULA. -DisplayEULA Display the URL to the Microsoft Services Agreement whose terms govern the Microsoft Support Recovery Assistant usage. -Language Language version of software to install, e.g. "en/us" for OfficeSetupScenario -Platform Platform architecture to install, 32 or 64 for OfficeSetupScenario -NewProfileName The -NewProfileName switch is optional for the OutlookEmailSetupScenario scenario. New name for outlook profile creation. -SkipCreateProfile The -SkipCreateProfile switch is optional for the OutlookAuthCheckScenario scenario. Avoids trying to create a profile with the current profile name -Help Display a link to online content (for additional details). -? Display information on all supported switches.
Examples (minimum switches needed): SaRACmd.exe -S ExpertExperienceAdminTask -AcceptEula SaRACmd.exe -S OfficeScrubScenario -AcceptEula SaRACmd.exe -S TeamsAddinScenario -AcceptEula -CloseOutlook SaRACmd.exe -S TeamsPresenceScenario -AcceptEula -CloseOutlook SaRACmd.exe -S OfficeSharedComputerScenario -AcceptEula -CloseOffice SaRACmd.exe -S OutlookCalendarCheckTask -AcceptEula SaRACmd.exe -S OfficeActivationScenario -AcceptEula -CloseOffice SaRACmd.exe -S ResetOfficeActivation -AcceptEula -CloseOffice SaRACmd.exe -S OfficeRoiScanNormalScenario -AcceptEula SaRACmd.exe -S OfficeRoiScanFullScenario -AcceptEula SaRACmd.exe -S OfficeSignInScenario -AcceptEula SaRACmd.exe -S OutlookConnectivityScenario -AcceptEula SaRACmd.exe -S OutlookAuthCheckScenario -AcceptEula SaRACmd.exe -S OfficeSetupScenario -AcceptEula -Language English -Platform 64 SaRACmd.exe -S OutlookEmailSetupScenario -AcceptEula SaRACmd.exe -S OutlookHangCrashScenario -AcceptEula

data.name: CommandLineHelpText
data.value: For additional information and troubleshooting assistance please visit - https://aka.ms/SaRA_CommandLineVersion

data.name: MissingUserFolderPath
data.value: The <folder path> parameter is required when the -LogFolder switch is used.

data.value: The <version> parameter is required when the -OfficeVersion switch is used.

data.name: CommandLineAcceptEULAMissing
